name: arrows-base
description: Basic arrow with clean geometry, neutral design, low-poly RuneScape 2007 style

metadata.name: arrows-base
metadata.description: Basic arrow with clean geometry, neutral design, low-poly RuneScape 2007 style
metadata.detailedPrompt:
MODEL: Basic Arrow

1. SHAFT: The main body of the arrow is a long, straight cylindrical shape taking up about 80% of the total length. It is a neutral gray color, with no specific texture. The diameter is consistent along this length, and ends abruptly where the arrowhead begins.

2. ARROWHEAD: The arrowhead is a simple, low-poly pyramid shape located at the top end of the shaft. It is slightly larger than the shaft diameter. It is a slightly darker gray than the shaft.

3. FLETCHING: At the opposite end of the arrowhead, three equally spaced, low-poly triangular shapes represent the feathers or fletching. They are about one-fifth of the total arrow length and have a slightly lighter gray color than the shaft. 

4. NOCK: The very end of the shaft, behind the fletching, is a small cylindrical indent designed to accommodate the bowstring.

Overall, the arrow maintains a clean and simple geometric design, with a clear silhouette that is instantly recognizable. The neutral color palette allows for easy retexturing later. The model reflects the iconic old-school RuneScape 2007 style, with its low-poly count and simple shapes.
metadata.workflow: GPT-4 → GPT-Image-1 → Meshy Image-to-3D (Base Model)

name: body-leather-01-leather
description: Basic leather chest armor with clean geometry, neutral design, low-poly RuneScape 2007 style

metadata.name: body-leather-01-leather
metadata.description: Basic leather chest armor with clean geometry, neutral design, low-poly RuneScape 2007 style
metadata.detailedPrompt:
Base Model: Basic Leather Chest Armor

Shape and Form: The basic structure of the chest armor is a simple, form-fitting body panel that extends down to the waist. It has a slightly convex shape to accommodate the chest and abdomen of the wearer. The shoulders are covered with small, rounded caps that extend to the upper arm. The back mirrors the front in shape and structure.

Geometry and Detail: The armor features clean, low-poly geometry. The chest and back panels are each made up of a grid of small, flat polygons. The shoulder caps are hemispherical, composed of a half-dome of polygons. Some minor detailing includes a low-poly belt at the waist, and vertical seam lines running down the middle of both the front and back panels for added visual interest.

Color and Texture: The model is rendered in a neutral gray color, with a flat, matte surface texture. There are no material-specific textures, making it suitable for retexturing with different materials later.

Style: The model adheres to the Old School RuneScape 2007 style, with a low poly count, simple shapes, and iconic silhouette. It's reminiscent of the game's signature aesthetic, with its charmingly blocky and simplistic design.

metadata.name: body-leather-base
metadata.description: Basic leather chest armor with clean geometry, neutral design, low-poly RuneScape 2007 style
metadata.detailedPrompt:
Model Name: Basic Leather Chest Armor

The base model has a simple, iconic silhouette that is characteristic of the RuneScape 2007 style. It follows a low-poly count design, making up the form with geometric shapes that are clean and distinct. 

Starting from the top, the armor has slightly curved, sharp-edged shoulder pads, that extend a little beyond the shoulder width. They are connected by a thin, rectangular strip across the collarbone area, acting as a bridge between the two pads.

Moving down, the main body of the armor is a large rectangle, which tapers slightly towards the waist, mimicking the shape of a human torso. It extends down to the mid-thigh level, providing ample coverage. The chest area is marked by two symmetrical, vertical indentations, offering a hint of muscular definition to the armor.

The backside mirrors the front, with the same basic shape and design, minus the chest indentations. There's a pronounced, horizontal crease/ridge line at the lower back area, suggesting flexibility and movement.

On the sides, under the arms, there are a couple of flexible leather straps, represented by thin, elongated rectangles. These straps are meant to hold the armor in place against the body, and they connect the front and back panels.

The base color is a neutral gray, with the straps being a slightly darker shade for visual distinction. All edges are well-defined and distinct, emphasizing the clean geometry of the model. The

metadata.name: body-metal-base
metadata.description: Basic metal chest armor with clean geometry, neutral design, low-poly RuneScape 2007 style
metadata.detailedPrompt:
The base model for the basic metal chest armor is a low-poly, simplistic design keeping in line with the Old School RuneScape 2007 style. The armor is symmetrical, with a simple silhouette that conforms to the shape of a muscular human torso.

Starting from the top, the armor has broad, slightly rounded shoulder plates that taper down into the chest area. The shoulder plates have a clean, curved geometry to allow for the natural movement of the wearer's arms.

The chest area is smooth and slightly convex, mimicking the shape of a fit, muscular chest. The pecs are subtly defined in the design. It extends downwards to cover the abdomen and the waist, with the overall shape resembling an upside down triangle. 

The back of the armor mirrors the front in terms of shape and design, providing full coverage to the wearer's back. 

There are two straps on each side of the armor, connecting the front and back. These are located just below the chest area and above the waist, allowing for a snug and secure fit.

The base color is a neutral gray, with a matte finish to avoid any specific metallic texture. This design leaves ample room for retexturing with different materials later on. The edges of the armor and the straps are outlined slightly darker to provide a sense of depth and dimension. 

The geometry of the armor is clean and clear, with no unnecessary embellishments or details. The design is simple and iconic, allowing it to be instantly recognizable as a

name: bow-base
description: Basic bow with clean geometry, simple wood design, low-poly RuneScape 2007 style

metadata.name: bow-base
metadata.description: Basic bow with clean geometry, simple wood design, low-poly RuneScape 2007 style
metadata.detailedPrompt:
Model: Basic Bow

1. Shape and Dimensions: The base model of the bow has a classic, symmetrical, D-shaped design. It's about two to three times as tall as an average RuneScape character. The width is relatively thin, maintaining a consistent thickness throughout the body, tapering slightly towards the tips.

2. Structure: The bow's body is made up of a single, solid, elongated piece curving into a semi-circle at the top and bottom, connecting at the center to form the grip. The bowstring runs from one tip of the bow to the other, forming a tight line that bisects the bow's curve. 

3. Details: The grip in the middle is slightly thicker with small horizontal grooves for hand placement, providing a hint of realism without specific textures. The ends of the bow, where the bowstring attaches, feature small, simple, cylindrical shapes for the notches. The bowstring is a thin, straight line with slight angular bends at the points where it attaches to the bow's tips.

4. Colors: The bow, including the grip and notches, is rendered in a neutral gray, while the bowstring is white. No specific wood textures or colors are applied, making it suitable for retexturing.

5. Style: The design maintains the simple, low-poly aesthetic of RuneScape 2007. It has a clean geometry and a clear, iconic silhouette that is easily identifiable as a bow.
metadata.workflow: GPT-4 → GPT-Image-1 → Meshy Image-to-3D (Base Model)

metadata.detailedPrompt:
Shape: The base model is a simple, flat disk shape with a slight bulge in the center, making it look more three-dimensional. The diameter is about twice the thickness, creating a chunky, robust appearance. The edges of the coin are slightly rounded to remove sharpness. 

Details: A thin, slightly elevated circular band runs along the outer edge of the coin, providing a subtle frame. Inside this band, on both faces of the coin, there is a simple, low-polygon raised design – an iconic, stylized RuneScape symbol (e.g., a dragon head, a cross, a simple star). The design is symmetrical and clear enough to be easily recognizable even at a small scale.

Color: The entire model is a neutral, flat gray color, without any specific material textures or effects. No gradients or shading is used, keeping the look simple and plain for easy retexturing.

Surface: The surface of the coin is smooth and flat, without any scratches, dents, or other signs of wear and tear. 

Style: The model adheres to the iconic, low-poly style of 2007 Old School RuneScape. It's simple, uncluttered, and easily identifiable.

metadata.description: Basic coin with clean geometry, neutral design, low-poly RuneScape 2007 style
metadata.detailedPrompt:
Shape: The base model is a simple, flat disk shape with a slight bulge in the center, making it look more three-dimensional. The diameter is about twice the thickness, creating a chunky, robust appearance. The edges of the coin are slightly rounded to remove sharpness. 

Details: A thin, slightly elevated circular band runs along the outer edge of the coin, providing a subtle frame. Inside this band, on both faces of the coin, there is a simple, low-polygon raised design – an iconic, stylized RuneScape symbol (e.g., a dragon head, a cross, a simple star). The design is symmetrical and clear enough to be easily recognizable even at a small scale.

Color: The entire model is a neutral, flat gray color, without any specific material textures or effects. No gradients or shading is used, keeping the look simple and plain for easy retexturing.

Surface: The surface of the coin is smooth and flat, without any scratches, dents, or other signs of wear and tear. 

Style: The model adheres to the iconic, low-poly style of 2007 Old School RuneScape. It's simple, uncluttered, and easily identifiable.

name: fish-cooked-base
description: Basic cooked fish with clean geometry, neutral design, low-poly RuneScape 2007 style

metadata.name: fish-cooked-base
metadata.description: Basic cooked fish with clean geometry, neutral design, low-poly RuneScape 2007 style
metadata.detailedPrompt:
Model Description:

The model represents a basic cooked fish with clear geometry and simple shapes. It features a streamlined form to depict a fish, retaining the iconic silhouette. 

The body of the fish is elongated and somewhat oval in shape with a slight bulge in the middle, representing the fish's body. The tail is a triangular shape, tapering towards the end and widening towards the body. The fish has a small triangular dorsal fin on the top and a similar, slightly smaller triangular ventral fin on the bottom, both midway along the body.

The fish's head is a rounded triangle with a flat base where it connects to the body. The mouth area is suggested with a simple indented line, and there are two small circles for eyes on the sides of the head.

The model is entirely in muted, neutral gray tones, without any specific material textures. The poly count is kept low to match the style of Old School RuneScape 2007. The model has a smooth surface, suitable for retexturing with different materials at a later stage. 

The model does not include any specific details such as scales, as these will be added in the texturing phase. Instead, the model focuses on the overall shape and proportions of a basic cooked fish.

description: Basic raw fish with clean geometry, neutral design, low-poly RuneScape 2007 style

metadata.name: fish-raw-base
metadata.description: Basic raw fish with clean geometry, neutral design, low-poly RuneScape 2007 style
metadata.detailedPrompt:
Model Description:

The base model for the basic raw fish is a simple, elongated 3D shape formed from a low polygon count mesh. It has an overall length that is approximately four times its height, with a gradually tapering design from the head to the tail. The head is slightly larger in size, representing around one-fifth of the total length.

The fish body is a combination of ovoid and cylindrical shapes, smoothly transitioning from the head to the tail. The geometry emphasizes the vertical curvature of the body, giving the impression of a slight bending or arching typical of a fish's natural shape.

The head is circular in shape when viewed from the front and tapers towards the body from the side view. It includes low-poly, basic representations of eyes, which are round and slightly protruding. The mouth is a simple, small, semi-circular indentation.

The tail is represented by two low-poly triangular shapes, split approximately at a 45-degree angle from the rear end of the body, giving a 'fan-like' appearance. 

The dorsal (top) and pelvic (bottom) fins are single, elongated triangles extending out from the body and tapering towards their ends. The pectoral fins on either side are smaller triangular shapes, positioned just behind the head area.

name: fishing-rod-base
description: Basic fishing rod with clean geometry, simple wood design, low-poly RuneScape 2007 style

metadata.name: fishing-rod-base
metadata.description: Basic fishing rod with clean geometry, simple wood design, low-poly RuneScape 2007 style
metadata.detailedPrompt:
Model Description: 

The model is a basic fishing rod, designed in a simple, straight geometric shape. It is approximately 6 units in length, maintaining a consistent diameter of 0.2 units throughout, except at the ends. The rod is segmented into three even sections, separated by slightly thicker bands of 0.3 units, which will allow for easy retexturing. 

The bottom of the rod flares out to a 0.5 unit diameter, creating a handle, which is 1.5 units in length. The handle is distinguished by a slight curvature for gripping ease. 

The top end of the rod tapers slightly to a point over the last 0.5 unit of its length. Attached to this end is a thin, low-poly line that hangs down 4 units. The line ends with a simple, geometrical hook model. The hook is a basic curve shape, crafted from a 0.1 unit diameter cylindrical geometry, extending 0.4 units in length.

The entire model is rendered in a neutral grey color, perfect for retexturing. The simple, clean geometry and clear shapes make this model versatile for applying various textures and colors while maintaining the recognizable silhouette of a fishing rod. The style is consistent with the low-poly, old school RuneScape 2007 aesthetic.

name: hatchet-base
description: Basic hatchet with clean geometry, neutral design, low-poly RuneScape 2007 style

metadata.name: hatchet-base
metadata.description: Basic hatchet with clean geometry, neutral design, low-poly RuneScape 2007 style
metadata.detailedPrompt:
The base model of the basic hatchet consists of three main parts: The handle, the head, and the blade. 

Handle: The handle is a long, cylindrical shape with a slight curve towards the end to mimic the grip of a real hatchet. The top of the handle is slightly wider where it connects to the head of the hatchet. It is a neutral gray color.

Head: The hatchet head is a rectangular block shape with a slight taper towards the top where it connects to the handle. The bottom part of the head, where it meets the blade, is a curved shape. It is also a neutral gray color. 

Blade: The blade is a triangular shape extending from the head of the hatchet, with one side being straight and the other side curving slightly inward. The edge of the blade is sharp and thin, but without any specific texture. It is a slightly lighter gray color than the handle and head. 

The overall geometry of the hatchet is simple and clean, with smooth edges and a low poly count. The silhouette is iconic and easily recognizable as a hatchet. The neutral design and colors make it suitable for retexturing with different materials later.

name: helmet-leather-base
description: Basic leather helmet with clean geometry, neutral design, low-poly RuneScape 2007 style

metadata.name: helmet-leather-base
metadata.description: Basic leather helmet with clean geometry, neutral design, low-poly RuneScape 2007 style
metadata.detailedPrompt:
Model Name: Basic Leather Helmet

The Basic Leather Helmet model has a low-poly, simple geometric design that perfectly fits the classic RuneScape 2007 style. It is designed in neutral, muted tones of grey and white, devoid of any material-specific textures, for easy retexturing later.

Starting from the top, the helmet has a slightly rounded, dome-shaped crown, creating a clear and iconic silhouette. The crown smoothly transitions into the sides, covering the entirety of the head, leaving only the face visible.

The front of the helmet features a simple, rectangular cut-out for the face, starting just above the eyebrows and ending midway down the cheeks. The cut-out is broad enough to allow a clear view of the surroundings, while the sides of the helmet extend slightly forward to offer protection without obstructing peripheral vision.

At the back, the helmet extends down to the base of the skull, with a slight curve inward at the bottom. This protects the back of the head and neck while allowing for a comfortable range of movement.

The model has clean lines and simple, unadorned surfaces, making it ideal for retexturing with various materials. The geometry is clean, consistent, and free of unnecessary details to maintain the iconic look of old-school RuneScape items.

description: Basic metal helmet with clean geometry, neutral design, low-poly RuneScape 2007 style

metadata.name: helmet-metal-base
metadata.description: Basic metal helmet with clean geometry, neutral design, low-poly RuneScape 2007 style
metadata.detailedPrompt:
Model: Basic Metal Helmet

1. Shape and Geometry: The helmet is designed in a simple, rounded dome shape to cover the top and sides of the head. The silhouette is iconic and easily recognizable as a helmet, with a low poly count that gives it a blocky, geometric look. 

2. Face Opening: The helmet features a rectangular face opening, extending from just above the eyebrow level to the base of the chin, and reaching the width of the face on either side. The opening is defined by clean, sharp lines.

3. Visor: Above the face opening, the helmet features a small, flat visor that protrudes forward slightly. The visor is a simple rectangular shape, adding to the geometric aesthetic of the model.

4. Neck Guard: At the base of the helmet, extending from the back to the sides, a semi-circular neck guard is present. It has a slightly curved, smooth surface, wrapping protectively around the back of the neck.

5. Color and Texture: The base model is rendered in a neutral, matte gray color, with no specific material textures. This makes it suitable for applying different material textures later.

6. Details: The helmet's design is minimalistic, without any intricate details or patterns. This aids in maintaining the clean geometry and clear shapes of the model, making it easy to retexture. 

7. Size: The helmet is designed to fit the average head size in the RuneScape 2007 universe.

name: legs-leather-base
description: Basic leather leg armor with clean geometry, neutral design, low-poly RuneScape 2007 style

metadata.name: legs-leather-base
metadata.description: Basic leather leg armor with clean geometry, neutral design, low-poly RuneScape 2007 style
metadata.detailedPrompt:
Model: Basic Leather Leg Armor

Shape: 
The armor consists of two separate pieces designed to cover each leg. Each piece is rectangular, tapering slightly towards the bottom to accommodate the shape of the leg. The top of each piece flares out slightly to accommodate the thigh. The overall shape closely follows the form of a human leg, ensuring a snug fit when worn.

Geometry:
The armor pieces are low-poly, consisting of simple shapes with clear and clean lines. Each piece is composed of a front and back panel, joined at the sides with small, rectangular strips representing stitching or fastenings. The geometry of these stitching strips is simple, straight, and untextured. 

Design Details:
At the knee, each armor piece has a slightly raised, rounded shape to allow for knee movement. This is represented by a simple, curved line on the model. The bottom of each piece ends just above the ankle, with the geometry slightly curving inward to represent the narrowing of the leg at this point.

Color:
The base model is presented in a neutral light gray color, devoid of any specific material textures. It is ready for retexturing with different materials later.

Style:
The model aligns with Old School RuneScape 2007 aesthetics. It has a low poly count, simple shapes, and an iconic silhouette. Despite its simplicity, it is recognizable as leg armor.

metadata.detailedPrompt:
Model Description:

This model depicts a pair of basic metal leg armor, designed in the low-poly, old-school RuneScape 2007 style. 

Starting from the top, the thigh guards are cylindrical, wrapping around the legs. They're segmented into three parts, each overlapping the one below to allow for movement. The segments have a basic, clean, and smooth geometric shape, with slight curves to mimic the shape of a leg. 

Moving downwards, the knee guards are semi-spherical and slightly larger than the segments of the thigh guards. They are connected to both the thigh guards and shin guards by small, flat rectangular plates, allowing for hinge-like movement.

The shin guards, similar to the thigh guards, are also cylindrical and segmented into three parts for mobility. They taper slightly toward the ankles, reflecting the natural shape of a leg. 

The foot guards are shaped like simplified, slightly elongated shoes, covering the top of the feet and terminating at a blunt point to allow room for the toes. They are connected to the shin guards by another set of small, flat rectangular plates.

The entire model is in neutral shades of gray, with no specific material textures applied, ready for retexturing. Its silhouette is simple, iconic, and easily recognizable as leg armor, with clean geometry and clear shapes. The model is also symmetrical, with both leg armors being identical.

metadata.detailedPrompt:
The leg armor model is designed with a low-poly aesthetic, perfectly capturing the 2007 RuneScape style. The armor is split into two main parts: the thigh guard and the shin guard. 

Starting from the top, the thigh guard is shaped like an inverted trapezoid with rounded edges, tapering slightly towards the top. It is designed to extend from mid-thigh to just above the knee, providing full coverage. 

The knee cap is a separate circular piece that acts as a bridge between the thigh and shin guards. It protrudes slightly, adding a level of depth to the model.

The shin guard extends from below the knee to the ankle. It is shaped like a long rectangle with rounded edges, slightly bending forward at the knee and tapering towards the ankle to mimic the natural shape of a leg. 

Both the thigh and shin guards are divided into two sections - front and back, connected on the sides by simple rectangular straps, suggesting that they can be fastened and unfastened.

The entire model is rendered in a neutral gray color, making it ideal for retexturing. Edges are well-defined, and faces are flat, maintaining a clean, simple geometry throughout. The model does not include any textures, ensuring it is suitable for applying different materials later.

The silhouette is iconic and easily recognizable as leg armor, despite the simplicity of the model. Overall, the design is practical, utilitarian, and evocative of the old school RuneS

metadata.name: shield-base
metadata.description: Basic shield with clean geometry, simple round design, low-poly RuneScape 2007 style
metadata.detailedPrompt:
The basic shield model takes on a traditional round shape with a diameter roughly 1.5 times the length of the average player's arm. It tapers slightly towards the edges, maintaining a consistent thickness throughout. The edge of the shield is reinforced with a simple raised rim, adding some depth to the otherwise flat surface.

The shield's face is divided into two concentric circles. The outer circle spans the shield's rim to just a quarter way in, while the inner circle forms the shield's center. The space between these two circles is slightly recessed, creating a shallow groove that adds visual interest without complicating the model's geometry.

On the back of the shield, there's a simple handle for the player to hold. The handle is an elongated oval shape, positioned horizontally and attached securely to the shield's center. The handle stands out slightly from the shield's back, making it clear that it's a separate element.

The entire shield model is rendered in a neutral gray color. The model's geometry is clean and simple, with a low poly count consistent with the RuneScape 2007 style. This shield's iconic silhouette and basic design make it an ideal base for retexturing with various materials.

metadata.name: sword-base
metadata.description: Basic sword with clean geometry, neutral design, low-poly RuneScape 2007 style
metadata.detailedPrompt:
The basic sword model is designed with a simplistic and modest look, adhering to the low-poly aesthetic of RuneScape 2007. The model is completely symmetrical and has a proportionate, balanced design. 

Starting from the top, the sword has a narrow, pointed tip that smoothly tapers down into a straight, double-edged blade. The blade has a length-to-width ratio of roughly 6:1 and slightly widens near the hilt. The blade is uniformly flat, with a thin, centered ridge running from the base to the tip, splitting the blade into two equal halves.

The crossguard is a simple, straight bar perpendicular to the blade. It extends equally on both sides of the blade, with the length being approximately one-third the width of the blade. It has a rounded rectangular shape, with its width slightly less than that of the blade.

The hilt, or handle, is a cylindrical shape with a slightly larger diameter at the base, giving it a gentle taper upwards towards the crossguard. It is about one-third the length of the blade, maintaining comfortable proportions. 

Finally, the pommel at the base of the hilt is a simple, slightly flattened sphere shape. It is sized to be slightly larger than the diameter of the hilt at its base, providing a balanced end to the sword design.

The model is rendered in neutral grays, making it suitable for any textures and colors to be applied later. The design is clean

metadata.detailedPrompt:
Model Description:

The tinderbox model is a small, handheld item with a rectangular body and a hinged lid. 

- The main body of the tinderbox is a simple rectangular cuboid, with dimensions leaning towards being slightly longer than it is wide or tall. The corners and edges are slightly rounded to give the box a worn, used appearance. 

- The hinged lid is a smaller, thinner rectangle that fits the top of the box. It is connected to the body of the box with two small, cylindrical hinges positioned on one of the longer sides of the box.

- On the opposite side of the hinges, there's a small latch, represented by a tiny rectangular protrusion on the lid that aligns with a corresponding slot on the body of the box.

- The model is entirely in neutral gray color, suitable for retexturing.

- The model's surfaces are smooth without any texturing, but the geometry includes subtle indents and raises to suggest the presence of the lid, hinges, and latch.

- The model is stylized according to the Old School RuneScape 2007 aesthetics: it has a low poly count, simple shapes, and an identifiable silhouette. 

- There are no intricate details or designs on the box, keeping it neutral and ready for retexturing with different materials.
